result.execSummary:
The defendant Keith J Eggum was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Keith J Eggum is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges. On one or more other charges, Keith J Eggum was found not guilty. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Keith J Eggum is presumed innocent of the not guilty charges.

  • Keith J Eggum was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Repeater], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant Keith J Eggum in court, in custody, with attorney Bradley J. Bloch.    Kristi Gordon appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is refusing to come out of the bull pen.  Court makes statements.  Deputies make arrangements to bring the defendant out in a restraint chair.  Court addresses the behavior of the defendant.  Defendant brought out to the courtroom.  Defendant is yelling at the top of his voice in the courtroom.  Defendant has to be removed from the courtroom.  Defendant will not cooperate.  Court moves forward without the defendant.  State makes recommendations.  Attorney Bloch makes statements.  Defendant's mother makes statements.  
The Court Orders the Following to count #2:
Court imposes 90 days jail.  Credit 90 days.  TIME SERVED
Costs: $243.00  Court orders the defendant to serve 2 days jail in lieu of paying the costs.  Credit of 2 days.  TIME SERVED

Jury instructions filed by Attorney Bloch in court.
filed by the State

Case called at 8:30 am.  Defendant Keith J Eggum in court, in custody, with attorney Bradley J. Bloch.   Kristi J Gordon appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court addresses the issue of a hair cut and street clothing.  Attorney Bloch advises the Defendant has stated he wishes Attorney Bloch no longer represent him on this matter. Court addresses the defendant all of the specific implications that has been done for this trial.  Court addresses the issues Attorney Bloch made a record of.  Defendant wishes to go to trial today.  Defendant wishes Attorney Bloch to represent him at this trial.  Defendant wishes to keep his inmate clothes and chains on for trial.  Court makes statements.  Attorney Bloch makes statements regarding representing this defendant.  Court is not willing to release Attorney Bloch as counsel.  Court sends the defendant back to the jail to change into street clothes.  Court reconvenes at 9:11 am, defendant returns in street clothes.  Court addresses the preliminary instructions with counsel.  Attorney Bloch makes statements.  Court calls for the jury at 9:24 am.  Jury arrives at 9:39 am.  18 jurors seated in the jury box.  All potential jurors sworn in.  Court introduces staff and parties.  Court conducts Voir dire.  Juror #9 struck for cause, court calls juror #19 to the jury box.  Voir dire continues.  Juror #16 struck for cause, court calls juror #20 to the jury box.  Voir dire continues.  Sidebar called at 10:24 am.  Peremptory jury selection begins.  Court calls the 12 jurors selected to try this case.  Remainder of the jurors are excused.  12 jurors sworn in.  Court takes a short recess.  Court reconvenes at 10:45 am.  Court addresses sidebar called at 10:24 am.  Parties address video to be played.  Attorney Bloch moves for exclusion of witnesses.  Court will order all witnesses are excluded as stated.  12 jurors have returned to the courtroom.  Court reads opening jury instruction.  Attorney Gordon gives opening statements.  Attorney Bloch reserves to give opening statements.  State calls witness Chief Donald Gaglione, sworn in, testified.  Court excuses the jury during testimony to addresses the defendants outbursts.  Jury returns at 11:29 am.  Testimony continues.  Court breaks for lunch, to return at 1:30 pm.  Court reconvenes at 1:28 pm.  Jury returned to the jury box.  Testimony of Chief Donald Gaglione continued.  State calls witness Sargent Karen Dingman, sworn in, testified. Court takes a short recess.  Court addresses the outbursts of the defendant once again.  After the jury is removed, Defendant told Judge Ramirez to "Fuck Off".  Defendant removed from the courtroom.  Court makes record.  Defendant brought back to the courtroom.  Court reconvenes at 3:17 pm. State rests and enters exhibit #1 into evidence, received.  Court addresses the defendant.  Attorney Bloch advises the defendant has chosen not to testify.  Attorney Bloch moves to dismiss.  Attorney Gordon moves to deny the motion to dismiss.  Defendant tells Judge Ramirez "Fuck You Judge" and is removed from the courtroom.   Defendant continued to yell from the bull pen to Judge Ramirez to "Suck a Fucking Dick, and "Eat a Whole Bag of Dick Judge."  (JUDGE RAMIREZ SPECIFICALLY REQUIRED THIS LANGUAGE TO BE INCLUDED IN THESE MINUTES).  Court finds the defendant has absented himself from these proceedings by his actions.  Captain Frank McElderry sworn in, testified regarding the defendant's actions.  Defendant does not wish to participate or listen to the rest of the Court hearing.  Court finds the defendant has waived his right to be present.  Court denies the motion to dismiss.  Parties address Attorney Bloch's proposed jury instruction and the Court's proposed jury instructions.  Court takes a short recess.  Reconvenes at 4:14 pm.  Jury returns to the courtroom at 4:22 pm.  Court reads the jury instructions to the jury.  Attorney Gordon gives closing statements.  Attorney Bloch gives closing arguments.  Attorney Gordon gives rebuttal closing arguments. Court reads jury instruction.  Bailiffs sworn in.  Deliberation begins at 5:19 pm.  Jury sends the Court a question at 6:09 pm.  Court reconvenes at 6:12 pm.  Court sends the jury a response.  Jury states they have a verdict at 6:32 pm.  Court reconvenes at 6:34 pm.  Court reads the verdicts as follows:  As to the Disorderly Conduct charge: GUILTY.  As the Resisting an officer charge: NOT GUILTY.  Court polls the jury.  State moves to enter judgment on the verdict of Disorderly Conduct.  Sentencing hearing scheduled.

Cases 14CF758 and 14CF862 called for an evidentiary hearing.  Defendant Keith J Eggum appeared by phone, in custody, from Waupun CI. Random Listing Report - Voir Dire
Voir Dire List

Defendant Keith J Eggum in court.  Ted S. Szczupakiewicz and Melissa Zilavy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant admonished for being late.  Parties are still in a trial posture.  Potential jurors called for and Court takes recess at 8:57.  Trial resumed at 8:59.  Parties discuss the bail jumping charge.  State maintains that it should be a felony.  Potential jurors arrive at 9:08.  Potential jurors sworn in on voir dire.  Court conducts voir dire.  State conducts voir dire.  Defendant conducts voir dire.  State exercises peremptory strikes.  Defendant advises he does not wish to exercise his peremptory strikes.  Court will do the strikes for him.  12 jurors selected and empaneled.  Remaining potential jurors excused at 9:59.  Jurors sworn in to try the issues.  Jurors excused at 10:03.  Court takes recess at 10:06.  Trial resumed at 10:22.  Discussion regarding comments made by the defendant during the break.  Jurors recalled at 10:24.  Court reads preliminary jury instructions.  Opening statements made by the State.  Opening comments made by defendant.  Jurors allowed to take notes.  State calls Chief Donald Gaglione to the stand.  Chief Gaglione sworn in and testified on direct examination, cross examination and redirect.  State calls Sergeant Karen Dingman to the stand.  Sergeant Dingman sworn in and testified on direct examination and cross examination.  State calls Deputy Tyler Loftus to the stand.  Deputy Loftus sworn in and testified on direct examination, cross examination, redirect and recross.  Jurors excused at 11:48.  Exhibit 1 marked, offered and received by the Court.  State rests.  Court advises defendant of his right to choose to testify or to choose not to testify.  Discussion regarding prior convictions.  Parties agree to 8 prior convictions if the defendant testifies.  Court conducts jury instruction conference.  Verdicts to be prepared as follows: 14CF758, Count 2 shall be referred to as Count 1 on the verdict form.  14CF758, Count 3 shall be referred to as Count 2 on the verdict form.  14CF862, Count 1 shall be referred to as Count 3 on the verdict form.  Court takes recess at 12:37.  Trial resumed at 1:42.  Defendant has decided not to testify.  Court conducts colloquy with defendant.  Jurors recalled at 1:45.  Defendant calls S.S. to the stand.  S.S. sworn in and testified on direct examination, cross examination and redirect.  Defense rests.  State has no rebuttal.  Court declares testimony and evidence closed.  Jurors excused at 1:53.  Court takes recess at 1:59.  Trial resumed and jurors recalled at 2:09.  Closing arguments by the State.  Closing arguments by the defense.  Rebuttal by the State.  Court reads jury instructions.  Jurors excused to deliberate at 2:50.  Court takes recess at 2:54.  Jurors submit a note at 3:28 which is marked as Court's Exhibit 1.  Trial resumed at 3:43.  Jurors recalled at 3:46.  Jurors advised they may take Exhibit 1 into the jury room.  Court cannot answer their second question.  Jurors excused to continue deliberations at 3:49.  Jurors reach a verdict at 4:00.  Trial resumed and jurors recalled at 4:11.  Jurors find the defendant guilty as to all 3 counts.  Court polls the jurors.  Jurors discharged at 4:15.  Statements by defendant.  State moves for judgment on the verdicts.  Defendant objects.  Court grants the motion of the State and finds defendant guilty on all three counts.  State requests adjourned sentencing date.  State takes no position on bail.  Bail remains as fixed.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for February 12, 2015 at 02:45 pm.
